Reviews.Title: “Average stay, nice view though”
Reviews.Author: EWill721
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine, but nothing memorable. As other reviews mentioned, this place could really use a remodel. You'll roll your eyes at the Texas kitsch. The front desk staff was pleasant. Check in went quickly. They were prompt and courteous with questions we asked and they called a cab for us when we were ready to go out. So, the service was good. We stayed on the 15th floor. HIghway/train noise was very noticeable. I suppose that's hard to avoid when an entire wall is windows. Heads up: our room didn't have a little refrigerator or microwave. I found that odd. Also, their room service ends at 11:00 p.m. & we couldn't find any snack vending machines, only soda machines. So when we returned late that night from a concert we had attended, we were kind of hungry and couldn't get any snacks. All in all, it was on okay stay. Pretty much what you'd expect when you're spending under $200 in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine, parking lot issues”
Reviews.Author: rudycharlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our volleyball team parents this past weekend. Got excellent group rate and the hotel proved conveniently located and near a lot of restaurants. The hotel is a bit dated and the beds are small. Our room was stuffy and warm. The thermostat stayed on 60 the whole weekend but I don't think it ever got below 75 in the room. Please be aware that they have had multiple auto break ins in their parking lot that is in front of the hotel and though well lighted my vehicle was broken into by smashing my side windows. The same night two others were also broken into. Later we found out from the police that this area is a frequent target of auto theives and vandalism to parked cars. If you must stay here, park close as you can to the hotel and leave absolutely nothing in your car.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: UNTMoms
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very accomodating. Enjoyed cocktails in the spacious lounge. Ordered room service breakfast and were very pleased. Conviently located.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort”
Reviews.Author: edcarmona
Reviews.Content: In Dallas for a soccer tournament. Has very comfortable beds. Staff goes out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Stay on the lower floors as the upper floors tend to get hotter. The extras are with in walking distance of many resturants. Laundry mat at Park street only 5 minute drive. Many stores close by. A nice work out center on second floor. Several computers in the business center. Will stay on my return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Generally average hotel, with a special surprise for me this time.”
Reviews.Author: grover_tx
Reviews.Content: The property is dated, no question, and the rooms clearly could use some sprucing up. However, the location is good, and once you know your way around the immediate area, the hotel is convenient. I have stayed here several times but never bothered to write a review, as I figured it was an adequate hotel for business trips, well located and you pretty much get what you pay for here - nothing special one way or the other. Breakfast buffet is pretty good, although not cheap. Parking in the lot outside is convenient, but it's uncovered so during the summer try to stay in the hotel's shade or the Dallas sun will bake the inside of your car like a pizza oven. My other stays here were uneventful. So we get to why I wrote the review this time. Simply put, I got an unpleasant surprise in the bathroom - a dirty washcloth was left over the top of the shower curtain. I didn't notice it until I was brushing my teeth getting ready for bed. It was dried into a curved shape over the shower rod and yes, brace yourselves, it had hairs on it. Not to be too dramatic, but I was thoroughly disgusted. I picked it up with a clean washcloth and threw it in the corner of the open closet. Just plain nastiness. My point is when you see things like this it calls into question the training of the cleaning staff and the care they take. Okay you may say that's one thing and everybody makes mistakes. Yes, that is true, but worse than finding the dirty old washcloth - mostly it makes you wonder what else they missed. I also noticed the clean towels didn't smell all that clean, plus the air freshener scent was overwheming, making me wonder whether they were covering up smoke or, worse, the sickness of the last person who stayed in the room and found a dirty, crusted, hairy washcloth greeting them in the bathroom. Hey folks, it is what it is. All that being said, the little contact I had with hotel staff was pleasant and they seemed generally friendly. Also, my room was pitch black once I used binder clips on the curtains. That was great for me. Most hotels have all sorts of LED lights and light coming through the doors even with towels under them. You take the good with the bad when you spend under $200 at a business hotel during the week in a big city, and I can and will make some compromises because my clients will not pay for me to stay at the W, but the washcloth incident and air-freshener fiesta will affect my decision as to whether to stay here again. It's probably not enough to write the property off for good on my frequent trips to Dallas, but I will have to give it some time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: HotDogChamp
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for 20 years now. It is true that it is showing it's age a bit, but it is still one of my favorites. The location is good for business or pleasure purposes in north Dallas. The upper rooms provide great views of the area. The employees are very friendly and helpful. All in all I would recommend this hotel, but with the following caveats: There are two negatives: 1. The pillows are way too soft. 2. The price of drinks at the hotel bar is $11 per drink. At that price you should go elsewhere for beverages.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but nice”
Reviews.Author: hikintex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was one of the hotels on the list for a wedding. It was very easy and convenient to get to, right off the freeway. I noticed that there was a mall just down the street but did not have time to visit. We stayed on the 20th floor in room 2016 & 2014 which were both corner rooms with king beds. The 2 sides of the room were glass and it was a beautiful view of Dallas. The beds were comfy and the room service was quick and tasty. Staff was pleasant upon arrival. We had to call housekeeping to come and change our sheets because it appeared that debris was coming out of the AC vents and onto the bedding. They did this within an hour and offered to change us to another room so they could clean out the vents but we loved the location so much we stayed. Overall the hotel is nice but you can tell it is a little older.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and east access”
Reviews.Author: RLT45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It was close to all of my interests which makes it nice really handy. The personal we encountered were all very well trained and friendly. We did not eat there but the restaurant looked inviting. I would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: gogogo28
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Doubletree Campbell Center many times because we appreciate its location, the pleasant rooms, the Hilton Honors amenities,and especially the responsive staff. But a recent stay shows how extraordinary this staff can be. A sudden death in my family that we were visiting extended our stay significantly beyond our planned check out date. Without hesitation, the front desk staff arranged for a new and flexible check out date, the same great rate, and the same upgraded room where we began our stay. We felt the condolences they shared were genuine and they checked with us repeatedly to see what else they could do to lessen our pain and increase our comfort. Our sincere thanks to all the staff at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Groupon and took a chance on this hotel for my first trip to Dallas. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. The service was excellent. The king room was spacious, clean and comfortable and room service was delicious and reasonably priced (compared to other hotels). North Park mall was right across the street and the hotel offers a shuttle to the mall. I have no complaints about my stay or the service at this location. I would ABSOLUTELY stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Agree, great staff”
Reviews.Author: NYgal826
Reviews.Content: We stayed here right after Christmas and were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel for the rate we paid. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite that was large and had a panoramic view of Dallas. We interacted with several staff members and they all went out of their way to help us, give us extra discounts, coffee, etc. I ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning and thought the food was good, and the staff once again was GREAT. We usually stayed at the Clarion when visiting family in Dallas (to get a cheap rate), but now will only be staying at the DoubleTree. Thank you, staff, for making it such a nice visit for us!

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: rtpcpa_59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at teh DoubleTree Campbell Centre for our daughter's wedding. The wedding was at the Museum of Biblical Art just a few blocks from the hotel. The staff was accomodating and helpful. They made sure we were in a room that would not be disturbed by other holiday parties at the hotel. The hotel is older (I stayed there at least 28 years ago when a friend was married in Dallas), but it has been updated and in in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation not honored”
Reviews.Author: Shabbystayedhere
Reviews.Content: We showed up after a 3 and a half hour drive ready to take a break and settle in before visiting family. At 7 pm we were told our room wasn't ready and wouldn't be ready until 9pm. We came back at 11 pm and our room STILL wasn't ready. We ended up having to cancel entirely and make a different reservation at 11 pm to find somewhere to sleep... Wtf.

Reviews.Title: “11th floor nightmare! One of worst hotels I've ever stayed yet”
Reviews.Author: Avon20
Reviews.Content: Looks can be deceiving. When you first walk in, they have the lobby looking outstanding of course but then when you get to the rooms they were disgusting. Carpets were stained, i had cigarette burns in my comforter, food crumbs fell out of it too when i took it off. Wallpaper was peeling and looked dingy, none of the counter tops or desks tops were clean, they all had stains on them. No refrigerator, had to pay for wifi in your room. The hallways also had just a musty, old smell to them. I was there for a conference and when i came back to my room later one afternoon, whoever had cleaned my room had left my door opened all day so anyone could have got in my room. The food was overpriced, not very good at all and made me literally sick (for real, wont go into details). One evening i was laying in bed and i kept smelling cigarette smoke in room and it finally got so strong that i called down to the front desk to find out if smoking was allowed in the hotel and they said only on the 10th floor, well of course i was on the 11th floor and it was literally coming up through the floor and it was so strong that it made me naseous. So finally they offered us another room at about 11:30 at night. The location absolutely sucked. There is not much around and you better be packing if you go out at night. There also was a rail system that runs right by the hotel and it can be heard in the rooms. We had no rental car so we had to rely on the hotel transportation to take us places and even then they only covered a 3 mile radius. They also said they drop off and pick up every hour on the hour at a mall that was across the highway(it was only about half a mile away but too dangerous to walk to because of the highways) so we decided to do that one day and when were done we were outside before 4pm to catch the next shuttle and what a surprise no one showed up so i called the hotel and they happily said they would send some right over...another 15 minutes goes by and no one shows up so i have to end up calling again and once again they said they would send someone right over and we ended up waiting another 10-15 minutes. So finally they showed up after 4:30 so explain to me what happened to every hour on the hour? The only place to get snacks was in the hotel gift shop and since we had no car i thought i would go down and get some snacks and water since were going to be there 3 days. So i got two small bags of chips and a bottle of water and it rang up over $8! I looked at the charges and that flippin bottle of water was almost $5! so i said screw that and we took the shuttle to a grocery store where i found the exact same bottle of water for $1, seriously! They did offer me a a free breakfast for some of my troubles but i didnt even use it because their food made me so sick. On a postive note, they did have free warm cookies lol

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the nicest. No working vending”
Reviews.Author: sjalbertson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on trip involving SMU campus. It was close but u had to know where you were going. The hotel was ok. Adequately clean. Satisfactory room. Because there are aspects to the hotel that are aging one day when I came back in the evening I found my room door not shut all the way. I think it was the cleaning crew. Nothing was missing. Easy enough to have happen if you don't slam the door shut. More or less what I would expect out of this type and caliber if hotel. I was disappointed that I could hear what was going on in the hallway very clearly but my neighbors quieted down quickly and mostly were passing.g through. Also no working vending machines. One lady in our group finally found 1 working. I never did.

Reviews.Title: “Decent spot for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: PDXTraveler02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights recently in a king room and found it quite comfortable. I was given a "corner" room -- I say "corner" because it really didn't have any -- the edges of the hotel are rounded and I had an expansive semicircle of windows. Great light, but unfortunately only a view of the parking lot. The bed was very comfortable, and there was a nice selection of pillows. Everything was tidy and clean, but the room seemed somewhat dated (peeling wallpaper, etc.). The bathroom was positively cavelike, and with one greenish fluorescent lamp over the sink, not the thing for a female business traveler who needs to be able to see while putting on her makeup. I managed to emerge looking halfway human by turning on the hall light and using the full-length mirror on the back of the door. Room service was prompt, courteous, and delicious. (Try the breakfast berry banana split - fruit, yogurt, and granola. Yum!) And I am a sucker for Doubletree's signature warm chocolate chip cookies that you're given at check-in. Loved the funky western-themed furniture in the lobby, and the framed arrowheads. Very Texas, very cool! The staff I encountered were kind and attentive. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dcshoe
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, typical for a hotel of this type. Bath could use some sprucing up. Breakfast buffet - the food was lukewarm at best, one morning not even that. Fresh fruit and some frozen, eggs, rolls, potatoes, biscuits & gravy. They had an omelet stand, but not anyone there some mornings. Staff was friendly. Only big negative is that the property is close to the train tracks and Rt 75, you will hear both all night. I think the Westin Park Central is a slightly better hotel for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting SMU”
Reviews.Author: lggreen55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel several times in the last two years while our son was attending graduate school at SMU. The location is excellent, the rooms very comfortable, and the Easter Brunch was very good at the restaraunt. The hotel is very close to a mall with great shopping and restaraunts. I will continue to stay at this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Thus far. . . Number 1 hotel to me in Dallas! ! !”
Reviews.Author: ClarkeInc
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I decided to go to Dallas for the weekend to get away and relax with some friends. I booked this hotel since it was close to North Park Mall (which is across the freeway) and minutes away from downtown Dallas (literally 5 minutes). The check in process was awesome, I forgot the gentleman that checked us in, but he made us feel welcomed. It was late evening around 8 pm if that helps. I asked him about the special cookie that the Doubletree is known for, and when I tell you, that was one of the greatest cookies I have ever had, you would never believe me (especially since it was FREE). The rooms are very spacious, humongous floor to ceiling windows, spacious bathrooms and very well appointed amenities. We had a great nights sleep every night and I also had a sweet workout! The gym is perfect, from free weights to machines and treadmills to bikes. We also stayed on the 18th floor, now the view would have blew me away, but the Campbell Centre building blocks the side where we were facing downtown. Other than that the view is still worth seeing! I did not get a chance to eat at the restaurant, but I did have a chance to eat at the Lemon Bar which is located in the Uptown Dallas area. Overall my stay was phenomenal and I can not wait to go back to Dallas at the end of September and I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Linda62410
Reviews.Content: This hotel works great for my business rips to Dallas always clean, always comfortable. Nothing exciting except it is always the same consistent high quality service and good clean comfortable room. I do wish they had free internet - o h well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: TexasCeCe08
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and consider myself to be somewhat of a hotel snob. By that I mean I prefer a bit of luxury but I also won't pay exorbitant prices for an evening of sleep. The Doubletree is located on Hwy 75 which is North Central Expressway in Dallas. The location is favorable for many reasons. Easy of access to major Highways in Dallas, a myriad of restaurants both chain and locally owned within moments of the hotel and upscale retailers within one block of the hotel. Whole Foods is less than a 2 minute drive from the hotel and is contained within a retail establishment offering higher end retailers including Saks 5th, Layne Bryant and many others. Just a few moments down the street are many restaurants that include the flair of Dallas. The hotel itself is quite acceptable with a fun, eclectic lobby with a full bar, restaurant and a chic look. The halls in the room floors could be a bit deceiving -as they are a bit dark and the doors seem a bit old, but don't let that deter you. The rooms are large, the beds are very comfortable with abundant pillows. A Texas pride theme runs through the rooms with a bit of rustic hint. There is a coffee maker with condiments, a 6 drawer pine chest for long stays and a large closet with the typical iron, etc. The toiletries are from Crabtree and Evelyn and a step above most. Parking is free in a lighted surface area. If you are located on the Greenville side, you will have some Dart train noise, but it is extremely minimal. I would stay here again without hesitation. Nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “JULY 4TH GET AWAY”
Reviews.Author: pianoplayerla
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for the long weekend and won the Doubletree for a good price. Overall, a very good hotel. The warm, chocolate chip cookies were especially a hit after an afternoon of driving to get there. We were traveling with our son & his wife and had 2 rooms booked. There was plenty of space for "hanging out" in either room to decide on our next activity, etc. Plenty of hot water in the shower. There is no "free" breakfast, but we knew that before leaving, so was not a problem for us. The carpets were stained a little, but we know not everyone takes pride in leaving things like they found them. There were a couple of water leaks in each bathroom, but placing a towel under them took care of the problem and did not affect our stay. We would stay here again for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - when on business”
Reviews.Author: MasonGutt
Reviews.Content: The room was booked for me (so I don't know how affordable it was) and the whole conference took place in the ballroom (Skyline) and adjacent rooms. The hotel provided the food (three meals) and I have to say, it was extremely yummy! In three days I must have gained 3 pounds from eating too much and not exercising. The room was nice, the floor we stayed was pretty high, so we couldn't hear street traffic (which some people say troubled them). The bar at the hotel was also well serviced, so in the evenings we didn't go out. There is a parking garage just outside the hotel. When I checked in they handed me a 'Doubletree cookie' which was delicious (but then, I was starving). I arrived earlier than the check-in time, but they were very happy to accommodate me. Great service at all times, and I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for meetings and great location for business trips”
Reviews.Author: major7828
Reviews.Content: my company held a week long meeting here and I could not have been more impressed. Everything went so smoothly - the food was particularly excellent, not your average "hotel food." The rooms were great and I never had any problems. And don't even get me started on the cookies - they are just wonderful! Staff was overaccomodating to our needs and we never had to ask twice for anything, even when we made last-minute changes in the meeting. I could not say enough positive things about this hotel. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Barely ok, overcharged and didn't respond”
Reviews.Author: TTraveller50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is general is "fine". not terrible, not great. However. Our TV was going in and out. The engineer came up pretty quickly. It was apparent that if anyone moved in the room, the connection went bad. The engineer offered to give us a free movie and that was fine with us. He reasurred us that he would take care of it with the front desk. When I got the checkout bill, it said $0, so I assumed it was taken care of. But, I later realized that they had just charged my Visa. I have called twice and left messages and no one has called me back. It makes me wonder if they have a little scam going....

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!!! STOLEN OVER 600$ AND COUNTING”
Reviews.Author: Kleenl
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for 2 nights friday and saturday. I called three times to make sure to get all the feather down out of the room as my wife is alergic. We went to bed that night and her face swelled up from the feather blanket. We called room service and they came and took the blanket without replacing it. Now on top of that I have been so far charged over 850 dollars because they say i did not leave. According to the maid report there was a do not disturbe sing on the door so i have been charged for 2 nights so far that i did not stay and no one so far has offered a refund on these nights because they cannot prove that I was not there. I have a receipt for the 2 nights i was there for 232$ and it says in bold that if I need too extend my stay contact the front desk. I have spent hours on the phone trying to get this straightened out. I have never had this many problems with a place before.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating but the staff is great”
Reviews.Author: burbankgator
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip and am unlikely to return. When I first entered the room, I was greeted with a stained carpet. I understand hotel rooms are used by different people every day - but I don't want to be reminded of that when I stay in one. There was a stain on one of the towels and for a minute I questioned whether the room had been cleaned after the last guest. The positive thing I can say is that the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a Cheer Competition - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: baileykat
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location for our event. We were in town for a cheerleading competition at the Dallas Convention Center. The location could not have been better. Parking was great and free! Our rate included a free breakfast which was great. Breakfast burritos, fresh fruit, bagels, assorted pastries. All were fresh and hot! A wonderful coffee and tea bar with lots of toppings! My daughter and I had a corner king room that was amazing with large wrap around windows! The staff was very friendly, checked us in very quickly! I would have liked free internet, at least for Hilton Honors Members. I did think $9.95 a day was a rip off!!! But I paid it anyway. We will for sure stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “If you Stay...be verrry quite! SHHHHH!”
Reviews.Author: Kelliannb
Reviews.Content: My mother, daughter and I checked in, went to our room and immediately, the room next to us filed a noise complaint. The security man knocked on our door to tell us about the complaint, and said if we wanted to talk to each other, we were to go down to the lobby. I asked about the TV, and he said if we were to watch it, to keep it on mute and use close caption! I've travel a lot and have NEVER been told that I couldn't speak or watch TV in my room!! And the time was 10:30 PM. Needless to say, instead of causing problems, we slept-and the next morning, left promptly. We stayed another night in Dallas, and instead of returning to the Doubletree, we went to the Renaissance- Where we could actually converse with each other AND watch TV!

Reviews.Title: “Vehicle broke into - NO security at hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith2929
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely NO security at hotel. Thiefs broke into my car and took everything including rear seats! Hotel manager on duty offered free breakfast...you have got to be kidding me! I have stayed at hotel over 10 times in last year and WILL NOT stay there again. The front desk did NOT offer up a parking garage code for underneath when THEY knew that construction in front of hotel would make parking spread cars out further front hotel front. Thiefs know that and hotel should have taken care of guests better. I overheard one front desk employee say that someone else had items stolen also. Manager at hotel took incident info but never called back after that. Now I know why this is a HotWire cheap deal hotel...deductables alone on insurance are $1,500.

Reviews.Title: “Little amenities lacking”
Reviews.Author: Ellie068
Reviews.Content: The rooms themselves were fine, BUT I don't know when I have last stayed in a hotel room that did not have a small refrigerator. That was our first unhappy surprise. The second one was that wi-fi is not free: it's $10/day in your room. They do have a business office in the lobby that is free, so that was an acceptable alternative. Despite what the staff said on the phone, there was almost no place to eat in the hotel -- only an overpriced, sort-up upscale restaurant. Coffee in the lobby? Yeah, if you pay $2 to get a cup. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Completely serviceable but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: thelegalacademy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and despite the discout, were surprised at how expensive the rooms were for what they were. This hotel is one tower of three towers in some kind of business park. The room had wrap-around windows giving us a cool view of Dallas but there was not a ton to see. The bed was average. The bathroom was small and tended to get damp. The bar was ok but served me soda water in a styrofoam cup. Yeah, I get that ordering water at a bar is annoying but surely they could use a real glass. After all, the rest of my party was drinking. Overall, this hotel got the job done but was so lacking in character that I am unlikely to go back. BTW, who charges for internet these days? This is clearly a business hotel. Free wifi should be standard.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down Room, Broken Appliances”
Reviews.Author: tportillo
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to have booked a spacious room with a king size bed and sofa, refrigerator, and microwave at a great rate in the heart of Dallas. We were less than thrilled when we arrived to find the room run down with badly stained carpet with a tear in it. The ac ran constantly but barely kept the room comfortable (seventy-five degrees but extremely humid). The in-room refrigerator did not work - so much for storing milk for morning coffee and for saving special leftovers from dinner at a nearby restaurant for a midnight snack. We called the front desk and they said they could not replace the refrigerator that day but would replace it the next day. The next day they said they did not have a 'spare' refrigerator, so we never did have a working refrigerator during our two night stay. Our first morning, we went into the hotel restaurant for breakfast. We were on a tight schedule so did not think it worthwhile to spend $15 per person to rush through the buffet. We asked if we could order a la carte. The waitress said yes, I asked for a menu, and she disappeared. 15 minutes later the waitress returned and told us she could not find any menus but asked what we wanted. We placed an order (based on memory from the room service menu in the room). It took forever to get the food and I was charged $10.50 for a few pancakes with scrambled eggs on the side - nearly twice the 'room service' price. (Maybe she made up the price since she could not find the menu?) By then we had no time left to argue over the bill as we were running late, paid and left. (Picked up pastries at Madeline's down the street to store in our room for breakfast the second day). Staff was friendly and kind. Lobby and public area very nice. Shuttle to and from NorthCenter Park mall terrific, but rooms run down and appliances in disrepair. Beautiful view of downtown from floor to ceiling windows and very quiet for being in the city but I would hesitate to stay there again unless staff could guarantee a room with working ac and working appliances in advance. Left detailed comments on the survey card in my room. Will see if the hotel contacts me!

Reviews.Title: “tired, needs a facelift. small bar, bad food, nothing nearby”
Reviews.Author: tomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: room carpets filthy as is the hallway. the bar is tiny and very crowded with a stressed bartender (recognize him from the year before). there is nothing to walk to here, you are a captive unless yout ake a cab. dinner typical gross hotel fair. breakfast is ok. street noise high, can hear from prior room.staff helpful. we were driven to our resteraunt tonight in the van which did not clear the 7 foot high do not enter, knocking most of the fiberglass off the roof (heavy damage). 179 a night HIGH for what is really a crummy location and very run down hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay - Nice Room and View”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: I had a king at the end of the hall that had a panoramic view of Dallas. Since it was a short stay I didn't test many of the amenities. The room had a refrigerator and was on the small side but with the view seemed larger than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of customer service from Front Desk staff, decent hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Aidy6
Reviews.Content: The overall appearance of the hotel is decent. The main lobby, bar and restaurant are recently remodeld. The rooms and hallways could use some updating. I booked this room after receivign a stay & save offer while to Dallas. I was initially booked in a room in the top floor. The room was hot throughout my first night but I assume this was due to the large window walls. I was trying to consider the 100 degrees plus temps in summer months in Texas. I returned to my room in the following evening to find the room was still hot. I called front desk to report the problem. They proceeded to send the engineer to my room to check the unit. He stated the fix would take 45 minutes but stated we would move to the different room with working AC. The engineer offered free breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience and would drop them off. Although, we had to move, I was actually contempt with their kind offer. As we settled into the room, the engineer did not return with the vouchers. I called the front desk staff the following morning inquire about the vouchers. They stated that they would send someone up with them but the restaurant was closed for the day for breakfast. Since we were staying an additional night, we were okay with receiving them for the following day. I called again to inquiry about the vouchers when I returned and did not find them. The front desk employee that was on duty was breaking point. She was very rude and condescending. She questioned what â€œengineerâ€� volunteer vouchers in a tone that seemed as if I was falsifying the information. She did not offer to drop the vouchers at my room but instead requested that I go the front desk to pick up them up. When I went downstairs, she once again questioned who had offered vouchers. The lack of attention on their part in checking the AC is the root cause of my issue. If they would have followed through on their offer, this would be a completely different situation. I was not trying to get a free meal but it was the principal of the matter that they failed to provide somethign they offered. The lack of attention for their staff is what is frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: chop144
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location halfway between the Galleria and downtown right off of US 75. Prices are usually good, rooms are nice and they offer free parking. Many eating options nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a good last minute deal that gets you the smallest room in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain4fun
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute deal on this hotel and received a SMALL hotel room tucked in behind an elevator. We walked past it to the end of the hall. I haven't had a hotel room this small in Manhattan, much less Dallas! The hotel seemed like it had lots of rooms available, so I have to assume that the reduced rate was related to the reduced square footage. We conversed with the lady at the front desk and told her our wedding reception was at the hotel 23 years before. We didn't prolong this so I don't think the teeny, tiny room was personal. I was not feeling well, so I did not complain after we arrived. I was just amazed that the "reduced rate" was a reduced room. Pretty short sighted.

Reviews.Title: “POOR SECURITY!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelperson57
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel and I had my car broken into and had other friends that were also there on business and they also had their cars broken into and all of us had our GPS tracking devices stolen!For having security,they did a very poor job of looking after our vehicles! Don't know if they have cameras in the parking lot but if they did,again poor security!

Reviews.Title: “Musty smell; a little disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: MedicMan7
Reviews.Content: I have always been pleased with DoubleTree Hotels and other Hilton brands but this one in Dallas had a particularly bad smell in the hallways and in the rooms. It smelled musty, not overwhelming, but bad. Other than that, the decor was very nice in the rooms and the lobby, although the hallways were a bit drab. The library in the lobby was very nice-it's a shame I didn't have more time in there. I only had breakfast there but the food was very good and the service was fast.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel - expected more from DoubleTree”
Reviews.Author: MMTX4
Reviews.Content: Check in time is at 3:00p, we tried to check in at 4:00p and had to wait an hour for a room. The elevators are slow, as someone else reported, and the hallways are old and bleak, reminding me of a New York City apartment building. There is an old, musty odor throughout the hotel; except in the lobby/bar area where there is an overwhelming smell of vanilla. We called down for room service and received no answer, so we went to the restaurant where we had to wait to be acknowledged and seated. The menu says there is tortilla soup and soup of the day, which was not the case, only tortilla soup was available. Seems to be at least three conferences or groups of some kind staying here this weekend and the staff seem completely caught off guard and overwhelmed with the amount of people, which I hope is the case. I expect more from a DoubleTree.

Reviews.Title: “Musty Smell, Loud Traffic and Dirty Carpet”
Reviews.Author: bandit
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews about this hotel and some were good and some bad, so we decided to give it a chance. Arrived around 3:00PM - front desk, were very friendly and got us checked in very quickly. The lobby area looked really nice. Our room was on the 18th floor - a corner room with windows on both side. When we got off the elevator we started noticing how run down the hotel was - as we got closer to our room (at the end of a dark hall) we noticed wallpaper peeling off the wall and what looked like water stains. We opened the door to our room.. the room was so depressing. It smelled moldy and musty. The traffic noise was horrible (even on the 18th floor). There were stains on the carpet. I never went into the bathroom. We called the front desk and asked for a quieter room without a mold smell. She said that the only other rooms that were available were next to or across from the elevator. I immediately got on my laptop and began looking for another hotel. My husband got on the phone and called the front desk and told them we would be leaving as the mold smell was horrible and we could not stand the traffic noise. She was very nice and just said "I'm Sorry'. We went and turned in the key and she said we would not be charged. (From the way she acted, I don't think this is an umcommon situation). We had stayed at the Hampton Inn Fossil Creek in Ft Worth the night before and it was SO MUCH better than this "Doubletree". We are now at the Hampton Inn in Mesquite,TX and; although it is not a new hotel, it is CLEAN and Smells Great. It s also very quiet... I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone no matter what the price.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler085
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and did not have hot water in the shower on either morning of my stay. I complained the first morning and the front desk manager and the GM said they hadn't heard of this issue, only to later find out that others in my group and well as other guests had already complained this morning. They flat out lied as what else could they say. The second day, no hot shower again. No worse way to start your day then sticking your body in cold water. I think they are well aware that they have a hot water capacity issue, especially on the upper floors. Hotel was full and their system can't keep up. The second morning, I actually filled up my ice bucket with the cold shower water and brought it down to the front desk so they could understand the issue. I have stayed at this hotel 4 times for business, but never again - even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping & proximity to SMU”
Reviews.Author: karenspeg
Reviews.Content: Pretty average hotel. Breakfast buffet was a bit pricey for the types of food available. Room was adequate size and had nice linens.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be Better”
Reviews.Author: LoyB
Reviews.Content: I've always assumed Doubletree to be near the top of rankings within the Hilton System. After this stay I decided it was next to the bottom; just ahead of the Hilton Best Western. But then I remembered that Hilton did not own the Best Western Chain. So....... As a Hilton Honors member I feel that I know Hilton quality and the recognition that Diamond status usually brings. They screwed up the room type for my son and his family and did not seem to care, a special request for an extra room key was met with a definite surly attitude, ice machines not working and only on every other floor, vending machines only on every other floor and unable to make change, very noisy room air conditioners, slow elevators. I know Hilton can do better and do at the Hilton Park Cities and the Hilton at Lincoln Center. They even do better at the Hilton Garden Inn in Addison. Hopefully they can get their act together at the Doubletree Campbell Center. The location is too good for them to let this property go down like they have. Right now, its worth the extra $$$ to stay at a "real" Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and good business appointments”
Reviews.Author: Renee096
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was wonderful. Doubletree is easy to get to, and has all the amenities for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff...Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wgf1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a large group (150 -200). We meet twice a year; usually on the east coast in the summer and the west coast in the spring. This is the first time weâ€™ve met in the â€œHeartlandâ€�. The Doubletree did a fantastic job. The rooms are great, staff very friendly and accommodating and everything was very clean. The after-conference evaluations that our attendees fill out were 100% positive. In fact, things went so well we are going back in Julyâ€¦something weâ€™ve never done before! Highly recommend for meetings and conventions or single travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great price”
Reviews.Author: kkountry
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Dallas for a medical procedure. This hotel was recommended by the doctors office. It was conviently located to his office. The parking garage was nice because it was pouring rain and my husband had surgery and did not feel like walking through the front lobby. We were able to go from parking garage to room with out having any contact with people. Our room was very quiet and comfortable and clean. We had a pizza delivered, so we didn't use the restaurant. There was no remote control for the TV, I called the front desk and they brought one right up. The selection for TV channels was somewhat limited. They price was great. $89.99 with our AAA discount. Also, the warm cookies at check in were a nice touch. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrjanto
Reviews.Content: For the most part, we enjoyed our stay here. We did have a problem when they did not read my requests that I made with my reservation. When I complained about it, the manager gave us free breakfast at their breakfast buffet. We enjoyed the buffet. I was a bit surprised that they did not have a swimming pool. They had a sport area that was outside, but I'm not sure how that is intended to be used. I did not see any basketball nets from the inside. I thought the fitness area was well equipped. Most of the cardio equipment had a television attached. I did get a little hot while exercising. I think it was because the room has skylights. Maybe in the summer you'd have better air conditioning. We did not experience any problems with our room. The parking seemed a little quirky to me. It would have been better if they would have explained the parking garage. I chose to park outside. The lobby has free wifi, but you have to pay in the rooms. I did not mind taking my laptop to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler2000
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas eve for 3 days. The T.V. was a joke. No schedule in room and none on TV. Asked desk for channel line-up and were told she didn't have any extras. Asked to have a copy of the master made and when she tried to do it the copy machine broke! Engineer came and said to try channel 17 and we found out we had NO channel 17! The gal on the front desk was new and alone. She tried but was lost. Ice machine was out of order. Cable was very limited and we had step through every number. Had used the Doubletree for years in Phoenix for business. This was not the chain I knew.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK -- you can do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: hibachi
Reviews.Content: My family used to stay at this hotel decades ago when I was a kid, but I hadn't stayed here in 25+ years. My husband and I stayed here for several days over a weekend. We were in town to see family and also were working during the trip, so we used the internet access. Overall, I wasn't impressed, and I will not stay here again. On the positive side, the front desk staff were nice, the hotel had been renovated fairly recently, Doubletree still gives out their famous chocolate chip cookies, and the location is convenient (right by Northpark and the freeway). The biggest negative was that we got stuck in a smoking room, despite having talked to them on the phone in advance and gotten their commitment to reserve a non-smoking room. When we arrived to check in, they said they "they didn't have a record of that" and no non-smoking rooms were available. So we were stuck; if we had walked out and gone elsewhere, we would have been stuck with the first night charge as a cancellation fee. So we sucked it up and stayed there. What I suspect happened, is that because they had a very large conference in the hotel that weekend (some kind of "personal success" tony robbins type thing) -- my guess is that the conference ended up wanting more rooms / more non-smoking rooms, and the hotel accommodated the conference people at the expense of those few of us at the hotel that weren't part of the conference. Which makes sense from a financial perspective, but it screwed up our stay. The non-smoking room had been cleaned of course, but it did smell quite musty -- and the worst part, when I got home, was realizing that all my clothes absolutely STANK of smoke. I'm not particular sensitive to smells -- but once out of the room, it was obvious how bad the air had been. I ended up washing, dry-cleaning, and airing out all clothes, shoes and luggage I'd taken on the trip to get rid of the smell. A minor annoyance is the internet fee. It's standard for a lot of upscale hotels (the Ritz Carltons of the world) -- but, most of the business hotels now (and all the "discount" hotels) offer internet as complimentary. So that additional $10-per-day ding is unnecessary and I was a little surprised that Doubletree was still charging it. We weren't bothered by the conference crowds, but then we didn't use any of the public areas (they did look pretty crowded when we walked through). Parking was a bit of a hassle. The hotel shares its parking with the two big office towers next door, which means parking during the week is crowded, and then parking at the weekend was crowded due to the conference. The main front-door lot isn't large enough, and the underground parking is a little confusing/badly signed, and creepy and isolated at night ( so if you're a female guest alone, you might be uncomfortable parking in the underground garage esp at night ). Bottom line: there are a lot of hotels within a few miles of this place -- you can get a better deal than this.

Reviews.Title: “What an excelllent place”
Reviews.Author: StarTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Double Tree hotel 2 times. Both were wonderful . My retreat had a party at this Hotel. They give this delious cookie upon checkin. You just have to ask about and it is so soft and soooo good, but enough about that. The Room was clean & in excellent condition. I had extra towels all the time. When I needed something I just had to ask and it was there. The beds were changed daily. Their buffets are a little high priced for me, the food is ok. I did not mind the short walk to the food courts so I paid half of the price that buffet was.There are several places to go in walking are accross the street to the right. Also in the back toward the right. It is a very convient spot to stay. The only thng wrong was the cofee maker, I could not get it to work. The workers were really polite. The check out was swift and very easy. I would reccomend this to my mother, wait I alreay did and she loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel; marginal location”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: I was here, solo, for a three day set of meetings. I was fully pleased with the property. Check-in, and ensuing interaction with front desk, were all very positive, crisp and well-handled. Iâ€™m Hilton Gold, so was given a very nice corner room on an upper floor; floor-to-ceiling glass on two of the four walls- nice, even though the view was highway and office buildings. Room was certainly clean. Yes, yes, the bathroom had big stars on the wallpaper, and the hardware was in black metalâ€¦ this is Texas, and it was done in good taste. Bathroom also clean. The whole hotel had very solid wifi, and I was super happy about this. I must commend this property for the conference room we were in. Excellent food, frequent beverage refills, brand name stuff, and they responded to side requests very quickly. The restaurant was good, and thatâ€™s importantâ€¦ because there is nothing (as previously reported) in walking distance. One day, they even had a separate table out in the lobby for quick sandwiches. Very smart, nice touch. There is a Starbucks about a football field distance from the hotel, and they opened at 5:30am while I was there. Good visit. I wouldnâ€™t stay here as a base to tourist Dallas, but if you need to be in one of the adjacent office buildings, or have meetings here, itâ€™s absolutely fine. (and chocolate chip cookies at check-in rock!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lobby, good ambience”
Reviews.Author: TheHorseys
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree at the Campbell Centre in Dallas has charm and character; values so often lacking in large hotels aimed at business travellers. The hotel boasts a framed collection of native American arrow heads and the lobby is decorated in a vibrant and tasteful way. There's a comedy club next door. I had a corner room with good views and high speed internet, while breakfast was hearty with a good range of choices. The staff seemed attentive and friendly and there was plenty of parking out front.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterners007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while at a high school class reunion. It advertised free wireless internet access, but we found out that it's only free in the lobby, which can be noisy and crowded. If you want to use your laptop in your room, it will cost you $10 a day. And don't even think of using the phone to call anyone. Local calls are more than $6 each, though nothing in the hotel information gives the price. Heaven knows what long distance would be. We complained when we checked out and the manager said he would take $13 off our bill, paid by credit card. We'll be waiting to see if that actually happens! If not we'll protest the charge with the credit card company. Two Midwesterners

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugg
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Doubletree Hotel was for a conference. The hotel is located in what a friend of mine described as an â€œisland d in a sea of freeways.â€� Nestled between two office towers called the Campbell Centre I and II, the hotel is near the Northpark shopping mall. This upscale shopping mall is within walking distance of the hotel and there are several good restaurants located near the mall. However, there is no way to walk to any place close by due to the lack of sidewalks or pedestrian paths. The only way to get anywhere safely is by car, the hotel shuttle or a taxi. Be prepared to rely on your own wheels, a taxi, a shuttle or a friendâ€™s car for getting around or risk being hit by a car trying to walk anywhere. If you do drive yourself, there is free outdoor parking in front of the hotel entrance. You can also use the free underground parking directly under the hotel. Ask at the front desk when you check in about it and they will give you the access code for gaining entry and exit. There is an elevator you that will take directly from the underground parking garage directly to your hotel room floor. At check-in the staff at the front desk was very friendly and they give out free fresh baked cookies in the afternoons. The front desk was very good about answering questions and making suggestions for dinner and lining up transportation via the hotel shuttle. The rooms appear to be recently remodeled and were clean. The beds were comfortable and they were fitted with down comforters and down pillows. My bathroom was papered with large stars, for the Lone Star State, somewhat overwhelming. The bathroom amenities consisted of face and bath soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, and a small tube of face cream, all Neutrogena products. Be aware that the water from the tap is not pleasant to drink. However, the hotel doesnâ€™t miss a beat and provides a large bottle of water on the dresser for $4.00. You might want to consider going to the convenience store next to the hotel or the Bay Street Deli next-door for cheaper bottled water. See my notes below for locations of these places. All the rooms have floor to ceiling windows with good views. I was located on the 4th floor. During the time I stayed here a winter storm arrived with rain and cold. Upon arrival my windows were covered with condensation and there were puddles of water on the floor window ledge. A leak in the window created a constant drip. When the rain stopped the condensation went away as well as the drip. The heating and cooling system worked well, but the room had a slight musty odor that must have been due to the high humidity in the room. The windows could not be opened, so there was no way to get any outside fresh air into the room. During my stay housekeeping was prompted, but they didnâ€™t seem to do a good job of vacuuming the room each day. They also didnâ€™t leave an extra roll of toilet paper, so if you arrive and it is low, ask for more. The hotel has a workout room and an outside running/walking area on the 2nd floor. The equipment was a good variety, high tech, some with individual TVs and included treadmills, bikes, weight machine, free weights and best of all a really clean exercise room! I didn't check out the pool. The hotel also has an agreement with local nearby gym that you can use for $15 a day. You can try to walk the short distance to the gym, but I would suggest that you use the hotel shuttle to get there or risk being run over by the local traffic. Room service was prompt, but the prices, were a bit high. They also charge an additional 21% for a room services tip and a $2.00 service fee in addition to the regular sales tax. A bowl of soup, $4 on the menu ran to almost $7 with the add-ons. The restaurant food, which is also the room service vendor, was good and the selection was adequate. However, if you donâ€™t want to spend a lot there is place called the Bay Street Deli that is located just off the hotel lobby near the restaurant in one of the Campbell Center buildings which are connected to the hotel. The Deli served a quick hot breakfast, hot lunch and sandwiches. To get there go past the hotel restaurant and gift shop, up the stairs, through the double glass doors and into the Campbell Center building. You will see it on the right as you walk down that hallway. The prices there are very reasonable; I paid $5 for a large two enchilada meal with pinto beans and coleslaw. This was not a simple quick dish, it really tasted like something you would get a good Mexican restaurant. The Deli is not associated with the hotel. There is also a bar lounge that is open to the lobby, just across from the hotel restaurant. The lounge opens into an area that is also a library of books that you can take to read. There are hundreds of hardback books available with a variety of titles. It is on the honor system to return them. The conference rooms were well lighted. The room we were in was somewhat cool, but when requested the hotel staff was able to elevate the temperature to a decent level. The noise level from another conference, across the wall divider from our conference, at times was annoying. There is light rail train that you can take to downtown Dallas and areas north of the hotel. This light rail train runs right by the hotel. Unfortunately, you have to take the hotel shuttle to the train station down the road a ways as the train does not stop at the hotel. If you do need to visit a convenience store there is one located just next to the hotel on the east side. To get there safely you will need to go through the underground parking garage and walk out the east entrance drive, across the light rail tracks and into the convenience store parking lot. Again, there are no sidewalks, so be careful. Not the greatest place to be stranded for a week, but it was pleasant and I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot to stay! Especially if you want to shop @ Northpark!”
Reviews.Author: BunnyMunny
Reviews.Content: Great view(20th floor-facing away from downtown, but still ok!). Nice comfy beds, clean. Not so great--no free WiFi in your room! It's 9.95 a day. You can use your laptop in the lobby area for free, or use one of the 3 computers in the business center for free. Also, TV gets only about 6 channels, most of them selling something, so not a full cable lineup. Movies were $12.95. They did have a porn channel titled "Pornucopia", haha, didn't check that out, though :) Front desk staff very nice. Restaurant had good food, even though it was pretty unoccupied. Lounge/bar area really busy on a Saturday night. Library sitting area in the lobby, tons of books. Kid-friendly. Close to the NorthPark mall. Close and plentiful parking.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel for not a lot of money”
Reviews.Author: farmers_daughter59
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Dallas, where we stayed at the Doubletree. We checked in on Christmas Eve, and left this morning (the 26th). The hotel was very clean--inside and out. Since it was Christmas Eve and a lot of restaurants closed early, we went to the bar and had drinks and food. The chicken fajita nachos we had were very tasty, and the service was fast and friendly. The only minor complaint we had about our room was that it had an adjoining door, so when some folks checked in around 10:30 that night, we could easily hear their conversation. Fortunately they were very quiet, but the next morning, we asked to change rooms--the hotel was fairly empty since it was Christmas. The front desk clerk apologized about our room, and found us another one immediately. She also apologized for not having a bellman available at that time to help us move, but it was no big deal to us. We also had a Christmas "goodie" bag hanging on our door that morning---a nice touch. The hotel was clean, and the staff was unfailingly polite and friendly. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant staff, nice rooms, but...”
Reviews.Author: pushthedonebutton
Reviews.Content: I visited in mid Oct 2007 and the fitness room and recreation area (deck, jacuzzis, etc.) were all under renovation. The corner rooms have nice views, but the rooms facing Hwy 75 are not well insulated enough to filter out the considerable road noise even on the 13th floor. Breakfast buffet is nice, witha F&B staffer there to make you an omelete to order along with the usual fare of eggs, bacon, sausage, juices, hot/cold cereal, yougurt, pancakes, biscuits and gravy and more.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Greenville Ave”
Reviews.Author: longhorn_mike
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in Dallas for the Texas-Oklahoma football game. Found it to be very convenient for access to bars and restaurants on or near Greenville Ave. The room was clean and comfortable, up to typical Doubletree Standards. Staff was friendly and tried to get me into my room early when I arrived at 11:00 am. Although they couldn't check me in then due to the high occupancy that day, I appreciated the effort. The bar in the lobby has a couple TVs and was good for killing time. I do recall that the price of a bloody mary was for some reason a little high relative to other drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Review”
Reviews.Author: MarianneAletta
Reviews.Content: I am typing this review from a King Corner room and j ust as I was preparing to write this 5-star review, Doubletree Guest Services called to see how I am enjoying my stay and to ask if I needed a wake-up call. Seriously? I've stayed at hotels five times more expensive than this without this level of service. Let's start with parking: easy, close to the front door, free. Lobby decor: Spectacular. Shades of a far more expensive boutique hotel. Reception: friendly, efficient, all of my Hilton Honors amenities (breakfast coupons, free internet access) were stapled to my room key envelope without my having to ask. Two people waited on me and, of course, the warm chocolate chip cookie was just what I needed after a long trip. The room key worked on the first swipe. Room: clean, bright, tastefully decorated. The shape of the corner room is very cool. I love the two walls of floor-to-ceiling windows! Room service: Expansive menu. Fast delivery (20 minutes). You can eat healthy (and inexpensively) in this hotel. I dined on a grilled chicken, artichoke and wheat pasta dish with pesto sauce. Just over 300 calories and very filling. I coupled it with a moderately priced Texas white wine which was superb for the price point ($7). Internet access: $9.95 or free if you're a Hilton Honors member. Con: no wireless internet access. Not a big deal. TV: What's this I read in previous reviews about there being no free cable? There is free cable. As a matter of fact, I am watching a free movie right now. That's it. This is now my favorite 'Hilton Family' hotel to stay in the Dallas area. I even like it better than the Hilton Lincoln Center.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice renovation!”
Reviews.Author: ProudTexan
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here a couple of years ago. They renovated this hotel very recently and are actually still competing the updating. The rooms and the lobby look great! Very nice job. The business center is wonderful --- three computers that provide complimentary internet access. The location of this hotel is wonderful. My only gripe is that the gym is not renovated yet so the hotel does not have a workout facility up and running right now. But, hang tight --- they are working on it and if it is anything like the rest of the renovations, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: SkiCountry
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent from arrival to departure. The Front Desk Agents were extremely helpful and informative, the bellman was also great. My guest room was very roomy and comfortable. The front desk called my room after I checked in to assure everything was good with my room, a standard for their hotel that I have not experienced at other hotels. I attended a conference at the hotel and the banquet staff, audio visual staff, and catering staff were all great. The breakfasts, however, during the conference had too many sweet items. It would have been nice to have some bagels or muffins at least. I realize this may not be the hotels fault if the client selected the breakfasts, but the catering staff should keep that in mind as they guide their clients through the selection process. DFW is about a 35 minute drive from the hotel which was the only downside. Overall experience was a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “The cookies are not the only good thing about DoubleTree”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The DoubleTree Campbell Center is a wonderful hotel. It is pricey but worth the cost. The rooms are huge. I stayed in an Jr. Executive Suite which was way more than I expected. The TV was smaller than I would like for the size of the room but for $149 a night I could not complain. I did wonder why I had to pay $9.95 per day for wireless service, in this day and age shouldn't it be free? The bed was very comfortable. The shower head although dated provided plenty of hot water. Finding the cuchy robe in the closet was a definite plus. This room would be a great room for a romantic night out. The room service was swift and very good food. The room comes with a minifrig, no microwave and no minibar. It does boast an alarm clock that plugs into your MP3 player.

Reviews.Title: “A three star hotel with a five star heart!”
Reviews.Author: NateHMS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in this hotel several times in the last four years and I have had nothing but positive experiences. That is not to say each stay has been perfect. I rate the quality of the hotel not only on the amenities, but also on how the staff deal with less than perfect situations. Although most of my stays have been as close to perfect, there was a situation where a pipe burst in our room. It left some of our clothes wet and got in the way of an important function that we had to attend at the very moment we discovered the mess. When contacted the manager sprang into action dealing with the situation with a "let's make the best out of a bad situation" attitude and professionalism that I would reward handsomely when my own staff exhibits this virtue. He comped the room, had our wet clothes cleaned before we left the next day (5:00AM!), and sent up two or three employees to move our things to a new room so we would not be late for our event. The hotel staff took a situation out of their control and made us feel like they did all they could to make us happy. As a result, it is the only hotel we stay in when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a stay for a business convention at the Doubletree, and I must say that it was excellent. Having read the other reviews on this hotel, I was a little worried. There is nothing better than expecting the worst, and getting a fantastic expierence. The meeting I was attending had over 200 people, and the hotels banquet, front desk, sales, and housekeeping departments were very attentive to all our needs. The food was spectacular, and the rooms were clean, and what a view of the city. My company has rebooked there for meetings in 2007 and 2008. I would definitlly recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria07-10
Reviews.Content: How much do I dislike this hotel? Let me count the ways. I really donâ€™t know where to begin. I stayed at this hotel in late March 2006 for a conference. The trouble started with the foul odor that greeted me when I opened the door to my room and did not end until I had to sit through a hotel blackout on the last day of my stay. There are so many complaints that I want to voice about this hotel, but I will stick to the abbreviated version. Some of the problems I encountered during my stay included stains on the carpet in the hallway; wallpaper that was peeling off the walls in the hallway; stains on the carpet in my room; a foul odor that lingered in my room for the two nights that I stayed; and a nauseating lunch of a soggy sandwich and soggy chips. I will never stay at the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel with a beautiful room, but it has a MAJOR problem. The pipes in the bathroom made really loud noises all night long! We had a baby with us who slept though all the noise - if he would have waken up, we would have insisted on changing rooms. But we were exhausted and it was most important that the baby slept. The noises woke me up at least every 30-45 minutes. When we checked out of our room, we told the attendant our complaints and we were told that they often hear that same complaint. So, I recommend you never stay at this hotel no matter how beautiful it looks initially.

Reviews.Title: “WOW-Great hote!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great time during my recent business trip. The hotel staff was very friendly and always willing to help with directions and general information. The hotel is OLD but CLEAN!! The room had a GREAT view of Dallas. The complimentary van service was nice. I received a hassle free late check out! I can't recommend this hotel enought!

Reviews.Title: “Fair business hotel, only accessible by car”
Reviews.Author: wise2374
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights on business, and found it fine. Hotel itself is mildly run down - on the outside and in the lobby. Rooms are absolutely standard - with small and older TV's than I'm used to seeing in the business chains. But everything was clean and comfortable enough. The hotel has a very decent restaurant and bar - I ordered room service and was impressed with it, actually. Views from the rooms are pretty nice too. However, there was some problem with the lone elevator that seemed to be working - a few of us waited over five minutes (!) for the elevator on the lobby floor the first night checking in. After that, however, there weren't any problems. The hotel is adjacent to the Campbell Centre, a business park, and there's a few restaurants and malls in the area, but very little you'd want to go to within walking distance. So you'd probably only want to stay here if you had a reason to be in North Dallas, and had a car.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, OK hotel for business stay”
Reviews.Author: willbegone
Reviews.Content: Excellent central locatoin with restaurants and shopping a short drive away. The hotel is very old and shows its age. I didn't see any activity in the hotel restaurant. The room was tired but OK. There was mold and discolortaion on various surfaces in the bathroom. The bathroom had a very low ceiling due to an access hatch that was in the ceiling for some reason. Check-in and Check-out process were OK. Parking was free and convenient. Although this property looks very intriguing from the outside with it's gold reflective glass, the inside is nothing special. Overall, it's an OK place for an overnight stay for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, with a terrific view!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree the last weekend in January. We were quite impressed. I purchased the romance package with champaine and chocolate covered strawberrys. We had a corner room and the view was beautiful. We recieved a free breakfast buffet the following morning. I thought it was pretty good. It had most anything you would find on a buffet. We had a marvelous time. Everyone was polite and helpful. We are planning another trip in the fall. I felt we really got our moneys worth. Thanks DoubleTree for the great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, ok room, little service”
Reviews.Author: DamnSaltyHam
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for a night, so may not be the most comprehensive review, but there were some basic issues that bug me at any hotel. First off, took us forever to check in because the hotel staff was apparently not aware they gave discounts through the Dallas Convention and Visitors Bureau. I had booked and confirmed the reservation through the DCVB website, and called ahead to make sure the hotel had it, but on check-in they attempted to charge me $30 more than the room rate I confirmed with DCVB. I know these things happen, and I didn't get irritated until they seemed openly skeptical of the rate I said I booked, even after I gave them a reciept of the transaction. It took several terse words and phone calls and 15 minutes to straighten it out. When we finally got into the room it was fine, terrific view and adequately comfy. But could have been cleaner in the bathroom (the oft seen stray hairs in the tub problem, etc.) and the air vents were grungy. Later we noticed old room service trays in the hall that should have long since been picked up, and that's never a good sign at a hotel that's not full. The place just had a deserted feel about it in general, staff-wise, that I wasn't comfortable with. That's probabaly the main reason I'd go elsewhere, staff training and numbers seemed lacking. On the other side of the coin, the big plus is a great central location and the view from the floor-to-ceiling windows in the room - awesome. If you do stay there, I would highly recommend the DCVB website for a good room deal, even with the check-in hassle, as the rate we got was way better than I have seen online or elsewhere for this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Dallas - Campbell Centre
HotelInfo.Address: 8250 North Central Expressway, Dallas, TX 75206
